page.title: 09LIFE IN CUCKFIELD-ELDERLY
page.content: After interviewing some elderly people in Cuckfield we noticed certain similarities in their answers to 'A day in the Life' They usually get up between 6.30 and 7.30am. Bedtime is governed by T.V programmes, but is around 10pm. Their usual times for breakfast, lunch and tea are 6.30am, 1pm and 5pm respectively. Excursions are restricted by physical disability or a lack of transport. However, some clubs like 'Silver Threads' do provide the much needed transport. T.V. is watched extensively with their programmes either to do with nature, documentaries or sport. Radio is listened to very little if at all. Hobbies range from gardening, knitting to making toy animals for social services and attending whist drives.
